app.title: Shazam: Find Music & Concerts
app.description:
Shazam can identify songs playing around you or in other apps, even with headphones on. Discover artists, song lyrics, and upcoming concerts—all for free. With over 2 billion installs and 300 million users worldwide!

“Shazam is an app that feels like magic” - Techradar.com (http://techradar.com/)

“Shazam is a gift... a game changer” - Pharrell Williams, GQ interview 

“I don’t know how we ever survived before Shazam” - Marshmello

WHY YOU’LL LOVE IT

* Identify the name of songs in an instant.
* Your song history, saved and stored in one place.
* Open any song directly in Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube Music, and Deezer.
* Browse concerts by popularity or search by artist, location, and date.
* Follow along with time-synced lyrics.
* Watch music videos from Apple Music or YouTube.
* Get Shazam for Wear OS.

SHAZAM ANYWHERE, AT ANY TIME

* Use your Notification Bar to identify music in any app—Instagram, YouTube, TikTok...
* Quickly identify songs from your Home Screen using the Shazam Widget 
* No connection? No problem! Shazam works offline.
* Turn on Auto Shazam to search for more than one song, even when you leave the app.

WHAT ELSE?

* Find out what is popular in your country or city with Shazam charts.
* Get recommended songs and playlists to discover new music.
* Listen to and add songs to Apple Music playlists.
* Share songs with friends through Snapchat, Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, X (formally Twitter), and more.
* Enable the Dark theme on Shazam.
* View a song's popularity by checking its Shazam count on the app.
* Explore songs similar to those you've discovered.

Availability and features may vary by country.
For more information on Shazam’s privacy practices, please read the Privacy Policy, available at: https://www.apple.com/legal/privacy/.

app.summary: Find songs, concerts, lyrics & videos. Play or connect to stream music now!

reviews.text: Really needs an option to report mistakes etc. and there has been quite a few. Have an issue where songs I was playing inside the app keep playing even after I close it. So it really needs a fix to stop that from happening.

One of few instances where Apple willingly shares a free software for the better of all users, even android. It's free, it gives you a free 2 month membership of Apple Music if you decide to use it, and best of all, you can use it to identify music on videos which otherwise don't credit the music creators. I'm not a fan of Apple, but if they keep making apps like these that are for the better, for everybody, then my outlook on them would significantly increase.

This app has been used by me for years. it's so good that it can even detect a song at the end as the music is fading with almost no sound at all. If you have no internet connection it saves an offline version of the song then tells you what it is when youre back online. I recommend it very highly.

Still works well most of the time, but has hiccups now and then. Biggest issue is that when it doesn't find a song, I'll use the Google song finder function and it's clear that works much quicker and better than whatever Shazam is built on. Failed Shazam searches turn up in three beats of the song with Google. Volume supposedly too low to get a Shazam result is no issue with Google. I still like the Shazam app and try not to use Google for everything, but they need to step it up.

1) it can't identify anything, even easy, throwaway songs that even a deaf man could identify. 2) The results that is DOES come up with don't display on screen. They are always "offline shazaams" so I have to open the app to see the song it incorrecrly "identified." 3) The majority of the songs aren't playable in the app anymore. So now you have to go to YouTube and manually search, or, Shazam will open YouTube for you, so that you can sit through 2-3 ads to find out its the wrong piggin song!

I've been using Shazam since it first launched, and it's always been my go-to app for identifying music. It used to recognize every song instantly—even obscure ones. However, recently,it failed to identify a few popular tracks, which was really surprising and disappointing. I've tried updating the app, checking my connection, and making sure the audio is clear, but it still struggles sometimes. I hope future updates restore the accuracy and reliability that made Shazam such a great tool.

this app is great! It gets songs fast and most times correct. Although sometimes they do get them totally wrong or unrelated, search it again and it will most likely get the right title, occasionally the wrong group though. What bugs me is that you can report a "wrong song" but can't specify what's wrong with it, or I hate when it comes up as a song displayed as being released in the 2000s (because it's a compilation album) when the song was really released in the 1970s or something! Please fix

protip on using this app: when you find a bad song just look it up on a dj website like sound cloud and there may be versions of the song that actually make it good and there may be versions that make it even worse but the important part is you know the song to look for the different variations of it elsewhere. Which should be a feature built into this appp but someones dropping the ball lol, "the suits"

this app is amazing! it's extremely helpful when I'm trying to find the name of a song that I can't remember, or am hearing a new one for the first time on an ad, movie, out in public, whatever! the only complaint I have is it won't pick up on the song (through your phone) when you're wearing earbuds. besides that, great app!

Shazam still doesn't disappoint. I've Been using Shazam for years and I love it. My favorite feature of the app is I can add a Shazam button to the quick panel when I swipe down for notifications and quick button panel. it also has auto Shazam bubble that I can move around the screen to where I want it. As for me personally, I don't particularly like that opinion. And of course every now and then it won't recognize a song, but hey what do you expect, a perfect app?

app.AIReview:
Shazam: Find Music & Concerts – A Comprehensive Review

Overview

Shazam, developed by Apple Inc., has cemented its position as arguably the go-to app for instant music identification. With a staggering 778,925,872 total installs and a robust rating of 4.827818/5 based on over 11 million user reviews, the app’s dominance in the Music & Audio category is undeniable. The core functionality – identifying music playing around you – remains its strongest asset, backed by endorsements from prominent figures like Pharrell Williams and Marshmello. The app's continued success reflects a sophisticated algorithm and a user-friendly interface that has repeatedly proven to be remarkably accurate across diverse musical genres and listening environments. This review will delve into the key aspects of the app, assess its strengths and weaknesses, and evaluate whether it represents a valuable tool for music lovers in 2024.

Key Features

Shazam's feature set is built around three primary pillars: song identification, concert discovery, and lyric access. Let’s break down each component:

  • Song Identification (Shazam Mode): This remains the heart of the app. Users simply tap the Shazam button, and the app listens for a brief period – typically 3-5 seconds – to analyze the audio. The identification process is impressively fast, often providing results within seconds. It works effectively with music playing through speakers, headphones (wired and wireless), TVs, and even car stereos.
  • Concerts: Shazam now integrates a concert discovery feature, leveraging its vast database of songs to identify artists performing nearby. Users can browse upcoming concerts based on their favorite identified musicians or explore events in specific locations. The concert listings appear to be dynamically updated, though the scope of this function is currently less comprehensive than the song identification.
  • Lyrics: Once a song is identified, Shazam provides access to the lyrics. This feature is particularly useful for karaoke sessions or simply understanding a complex song’s meaning.
  • Music Streaming Integration (Shazam Connect): A relatively new addition, Shazam Connect allows users to seamlessly connect their existing music streaming accounts (Spotify, Apple Music, Pandora, Amazon Music) directly within the app. This enables instant identification of songs playing in other apps and provides a direct pathway to listening to them on your preferred platform.
  • Artist Profiles: Detailed artist profiles are available for each identified musician, offering biographical information, related artists, and links to their official websites and social media channels.

Strengths

Shazam’s core strength lies unequivocally in its song identification accuracy. The app consistently performs exceptionally well across a broad spectrum of music genres, from pop and rock to classical and electronic. Its ability to identify songs even with background noise or muffled audio is remarkable. The speed of the identification process is another significant advantage – often providing results within seconds.

Furthermore, the integration of Shazam Connect represents a smart move. It addresses a key user need: the ability to immediately access and play identified music without switching apps. The app's design is clean and intuitive, making it easy for users of all technical abilities to navigate its features. The large install base (778,925,872) speaks volumes about its popularity and established reliability.

Areas for Improvement

Despite its strengths, Shazam isn’t without areas for refinement. The concert discovery feature feels somewhat underdeveloped compared to the core song identification functionality. The information presented regarding concerts can be sparse, and the geographic coverage appears limited in some regions.

Another potential area of improvement is the user interface clutter. While generally clean, the main screen contains a multitude of options (Shazam Mode, Concerts, Lyrics, Shazam Connect) which could benefit from a more streamlined layout, particularly for new users. A clearer visual distinction between these functions would enhance usability. The app’s reliance on internet connectivity for both song identification and concert discovery can occasionally lead to frustrating delays or failures in areas with poor network coverage.

Finally, the “Shazam Connect” feature while useful has seen some reports of occasional syncing issues between accounts – a common problem when integrating third-party services.

User Experience

The user experience is generally very positive. The app’s responsiveness is impressive, and the identification process feels remarkably instant. The intuitive design makes it easy to discover new music and learn more about artists. The “Shazam Connect” feature adds significant value for users who already subscribe to streaming services. However, as mentioned above, the cluttered interface can be slightly overwhelming initially. A guided tutorial or onboarding experience could significantly improve the initial user journey.

Value for Money

Shazam is entirely free to download and use. This makes it an exceptionally valuable tool for anyone interested in music discovery. The absence of a paid subscription model removes any financial barriers to entry, allowing users to benefit from its core functionality without obligation. The value proposition is clear: instant song identification at no cost.

Conclusion

Shazam remains the undisputed king of instant music identification. Its consistently high accuracy, rapid performance, and integration with Shazam Connect make it an essential app for music lovers. While there are minor areas for improvement in terms of UI clarity and concert discovery functionality, these do not detract significantly from its overall value. With over 778 million installs and a glowing endorsement from musical heavyweights, Shazam continues to deliver on its promise – making the magic of identifying music instantly accessible to everyone. It’s a testament to Apple's continued innovation in mobile technology and a truly indispensable tool for navigating the vast world of recorded music.
